alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 2:14PM CST until January 27 at 1:12PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River near Speaks. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with the approaches to the FM 530 bridge inundated and the gage cut off. large areas of the floodplain are cut off potentially isolated and drowning cattle. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 26.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM CST Friday was 28.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 7.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.3 feet on 10/14/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Navidad River Speaks 24.0 26.8 Fri 2 pm CST 18.0 9.8 8.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this eveningSaturday morning at 815 AM CST.
